We implement the transform \\(g(z) = \\mathcal{L}(z)(s)\\) and analyze its impact on the solution over the complex variable s.

After observing the transformed output \\(g(z(t))(s)\\) at a particular s, can we reconstruct the original function \\(z(t)\\) at t = 0 without knowing whether the Laplace transform was applied?
Explanation: Without knowledge of the application of the Laplace Transform, the original function \\(z(t)\\) cannot be precisely reconstructed. Since the transformation to the s-domain alters the information content by integrating exponential components, retrieval of the precise initial condition from the transformed data alone is generally indeterminate.
